description: Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports a web shell. It's highly recommended to tune this rule to the specific strings used by your anti virus solution by downloading a big webshell repo from e.g. github and checking the matches.
author: Florian Roth
Arnim Rupp
name: Antivirus Web Shell Detection
query: ((winlog.event_data.Signature:(PHP.* OR JSP.* OR ASP.* OR Perl.* OR VBS\/Uxor* OR IIS\/BackDoor* OR JAVA\/Backdoor* OR Troj\/ASP* OR Troj\/PHP* OR Troj\/JSP*)) OR (winlog.event_data.Signature:(*Webshell* OR *Chopper* OR *SinoChoper* OR *ASPXSpy* OR *Aspdoor* OR *filebrowser* OR *PHP_* OR *JSP_* OR *ASP_* OR *PHP\:* OR *JSP\:* OR *ASP\:* OR *Perl\:* OR *PHP\/* OR *JSP\/* OR *ASP\/* OR *Perl\/* OR *PHPShell* OR *Trojan.PHP* OR *Trojan.ASP* OR *Trojan.JSP* OR *Trojan.VBS* OR *PHP?Agent* OR *ASP?Agent* OR *JSP?Agent* OR *VBS?Agent* OR *Backdoor?PHP* OR *Backdoor?JSP* OR *Backdoor?ASP* OR *Backdoor?VBS* OR *Backdoor?Java* OR *PShlSpy* OR *C99shell*)))
